title: Add a loading screen teamchat.
body:
Be it to discuss invades now that you know your enemies' summer spells or just for chit chat.

Considering how long many people take to load it'ld be nice to get to know your mates rather than watching the same Artworks for the 1000th time.

replies.body: Good luck. Ive been recommending loading screen chats since Beta man. It doesn't look like they listen to their community on things like that.

I doubt it's a matter of not listening to the community. As with all things game development related, it's a matter of priorities. Sure, it would be nice. And very useful. But so are a lot of other things they're working on. I would also be that adding chat to the loading screen would require a pretty significant rework of the codebase, since that's not currently interactive in any way. To do that would require taking resources away from other things.

They said the same thing about the (now closed) GD in regards to summoner icons.

Then one day we had them, and found out it was implemented in a _single day_ by a Rioter during his allotted "work n whatever you think is cool day".

Yeah priorities are important ... but sometimes people overestimate the workload of a change.  Some are monumental to be sure (maybe this one is) ... but we seem to be OK with thinking all of them are ... which is just silly.
I've considered this too. I would actually suggest staying in the lobby until the game has been loaded by everyone, then launch it. Loading status could be updated near the user.

The only thing is, summoner spells aren't viewable from the lobby. That is an easy change. Should they be viewable to enemies after a champion is selected?

Would tell more about where each champion is going, rather than having to guess. Also, you would be able to pick counters more easily, which gives the ability to juke out enemies by selecting fake summoner spells and changing them when all champions are locked in.

I think you would more or less "unlock" them like they do for that split second in blinds when the game starts to load. While i'm not in load times that often I think it would be nice to be able to talk with your team to discuss the very beginning steps in solo que with very few people jumping into chat programs with strangers.
Why not add an actual voice chat...?

Rito, plz make it so that we don't spend the entire loading screen looking at the same splash art for the nth time or just being afk.

What else would take its place? Maybe some statistics of that champion for the player? Maybe one giant screen with one splash art at a time that rotates every 5 seconds. The full beauty of splash art is never seen, and its a shame, because some splash arts really compliment the champions nature.

This is a good idea.

Bump.

We all know what that chat would look like, don't we?

Household appliances listed "hilariously" in a sequence.

I'm sorry but this is an AWFUL idea.  It would just be a breeding ground of toxicity.  Lets have an example:

Lets say someone has a computer powered by a hamster while also playing on the McDonald's wireless.  Granted they probably should be playing league but it happens so we have to deal with it.  So naturally they take FOREVER to connect to the game and everyone is pretty unhappy about it.  Normally they have about 1minute and 30seconds to be a dick about it or just jab at them before the game starts and in MOST games that's the end of that.

Adding this, would just give players WITH OTHERWISE ABSOLUTELY NOTHING TO DO an opportunity to just abuse a player for the entire loading screen.   Hell some players are bad enough even when they have the game to distract them.  Games will end before they start.  THIS isn't even the only situation where this would just become terrible.  It's just one example of many.

I understand your point, and on paper it would seem like a good idea.  I think in practice though it would get really bad really quick and it would only end up hurting everyone overall.

"This is a bad idea because someone could tell the slowest loader to update their potato-modem in the loading screen instead of 2 seconds after the game loads."

If they were going to harass the player, they would do it anyway; why does it matter if it happens approximately 30 seconds before the match instead of during it?

> "This is a bad idea because someone could tell the slowest loader to update their potato-modem in the loading screen instead of 2 seconds after the game loads."
> 
> If they were going to harass the player, they would do it anyway; why does it matter if it happens approximately 30 seconds before the match instead of during it?

This was already covered but whatever:

1.  It's the length of time they have to do it, which is quite a bit longer than the normal start of the game.

2.  THEY HAVE NOTHING ELSE TO DO!  Often people do things just because they have nothing better to do at the time.  So even if they normally wouldn't harass the player, they will probably start because really there is NOTHING else to do during that time.

I'm glad to see you have such a gloriously optimistic view of people though.

For a cynic, I definitely have an optimistic view of people.

1) They have a longer time to vent before the game, as opposed to either venting in the first minute or just bottling it until said slow loader makes a mistake.

2) If a person normally wouldn't harass a player when the game starts, why would they harass them in the loading screen? Someone who does not have the impulse to harass people would not suddenly feel the urge because they have the option. That's like saying that a person who has no desire to murder would suddenly kill someone were they handed a gun.

> For a cynic, I definitely have an optimistic view of people.
> 
> 1) They have a longer time to vent before the game, as opposed to either venting in the first minute or just bottling it until said slow loader makes a mistake.
> 
> 2) If a person normally wouldn't harass a player when the game starts, why would they harass them in the loading screen? Someone who does not have the impulse to harass people would not suddenly feel the urge because they have the option. That's like saying that a person who has no desire to murder would suddenly kill someone were they handed a gun.

No it's not, that's a drastically huge leap.  Such a huge leap the two aren't even comparable.

Most people would view giving someone a hard time in a game over the internet either as harmless ribbing or just flat out trolling.  They don't view it as actually harmful to the person which is part of the reason why it happens so often.  It's the idea of "lol I made them mad, but they'll get over it."  

To them it's like giving them access to water balloons.  They don't have to use them, but it's not REALLY going to hurt anyone right?  Right?  It's because they don't view it as innately harmful that they would participate.

It's in no way similar to suddenly thinking someone will become a homicidal maniac.

It's on the same level of idiocy, whether or not it's on the same level of being an utter maniac

If you fill the water balloons with piss, then *maybe* I'd consider your analogy more accurate.

This idea is a nice idea. I mean normally you don't even get to discuss team wide strategy due to the short period after everyone picks. Plus, it gives the loading screen something to do. Not to mention there should be a button near each portrait that toggles an ability screen instead of a splash art (learning curve is hard for new players/sometimes we forget what a champ does when they fall off the face of the rift). I for one would at least like to be able to alt + tab the loading screen reliably without having the annoying black screen until the game starts.

I know we would all love a loading screen chat, but lets be honest hear, it might actually cause more lag then what yall might think, I would love a chat, about I don't think it is the greatest thing, maybe they can add something to help with the severe lack of entertainment during that time (if you want entertainment though, just alt-tab out)

it would also help keep people from minimizing the screen, i hate when people come back and say "oh whoops, i alt tabbed while it was loading"

Already there is a possibility to use chat during loading screen. Just minimize it and pop up client from the tray. How hard would it be to create a lobby with all the players from the team so they can communicate by it? HURR DURR THE RESOURCES! THE CODING!

Also this reddit sucks.

You have to remember, some people will have arguments on chat. Instead of having a team chat, have it like the home screen of the launcher, only with champions loading pages, but with a home button to do things while you wait. You can still have the team chat, but sometimes it may hinder the team's performance with rude people on there.
I'd love this idea. The loading times can get super boring. Especially with people playing on potatoes lol. Im all for this!

Adding a teamchat to a loading screen would probably make the loading slower, now that the client would also have to connect the in game communication systems before anything else and then send the messages while the game is loading. To get the chat to work, people would actually have to load the chatting system, which is probably a certain percentage of the loading % anyway. It would be nice, but it would definitely present a few problems if it is doable at all.

Let the flame feast of loading screen begin.

Also putting voice chat could simplify a lot in game (less writing, you can again concentrate on game and in the same time alert your teammates if your enemy is missing from lane), but it should have option to turn off, if you don't want to talk to others.
